title: Questions a passenger might ask about a flight
context: Ask an airline employee if a flight has a layover or is direct.

content.bestLine: Is this flight direct or does it have a layover?

neutral.text: Is there a layover on this flight?
Will we be flying straight to our destination?
Are there any stops on this flight?
Do we have a layover on this trip?
Is the flight direct or not?
Will we have to change planes?

informal.text: Got any layovers on this flight?
Is this a straight shot to our destination?
Do we get to stay on the plane the whole time?
How many stops does this flight have?
Do we have to switch planes somewhere?

formal.text: Could you please inform me if this flight has any layovers?
I would like to know if this flight is direct or not.
Are there any scheduled stops on this flight?
Could you confirm if this is a non-stop flight?
I need to know if there are any connections on this flight.
Is this flight a direct service to our destination?

patterns.meaning: Asking about the nature of the flight

patterns.template: Does the flight from [options] to [options] have any stops?
patterns.meaning: Inquiring about stops on a specific route

dialogs.description: Passenger asking about layovers at the check-in counter

lines.speaker: Passenger
lines.text: Hi, I'm checking in for my flight. Is it direct or does it have a layover?

lines.speaker: Airline Employee
lines.text: Let me check that for you. According to our system, your flight has one layover.

dialogs.description: Traveler inquiring about flight details over the phone

lines.speaker: Traveler
lines.text: Hello, I booked a flight with your airline and I was wondering if it's a non-stop flight?

lines.speaker: Airline Representative
lines.text: Yes, the flight you booked is direct. You won't have to change planes.
